# Qualcomm may buy Intel

The American journal "The Wall Street Journal" reported that Intel might be purchased by its concurrent Qualcomm.

On one side we have Qualcomm, which is an American tech company selling semiconductor products or software for vehicles, laptops, wifi, smartphones and many devices.



![Image](data:image/png;base64,)

And at the other side we have Intel, which is the world's largest manufacturer of central processing units and semiconductors. They are well known for their CPUs based on their x86 architecture since 80s and has been constantly upgrading.

The American journal reports that Qualcomm hasn't made an official offer, if Qualcomm makes this deal, it will be the deal of the year.

Meanwhile, Intel is having bad days because of substantial cuts and changing strategies, these changes cost them a 1.6$ billion loss in August 2024. This loss is also related to the reliance on TSMC to produce their cutting edge chips.

For gamers, aside from the Nintendo Switch, whose processors are made by Nvidia, most of the game consoles have an AMD chip, and Intel reported that they lost the PlayStation6 deal.

To end this failure, Intel extended warranties to multiple PC gamers after two generations of being vulnerable to unusual crashes.

[To read more click here ](https://www.theverge.com/2024/9/20/24249949/intel-qualcomm-rumor-takeover-acquisition-arm-x86)
